title: prysm stuck in error: Could not compute head from new attestations
body:
# üêû Bug Report ### Description my prysm process stuck in error prompts, could not sync any more ### Has this worked before in a previous version? Yes ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction geth start script: ```shell geth --txlookuplimit 0 --ws --ws.addr 0.0.0.0 --ws.port 8536 --ws.api eth,net,web3,debug --http --http.api eth,net,engine,admin,web3,debug --http.addr 0.0.0.0 --http.port 6745 --http.corsdomain '*' --http.vhosts '*' --datadir /data/eth/geth --authrpc.addr localhost --authrpc.port 8551 --authrpc.vhosts localhost --authrpc.jwtsecret jwt.hex ``` prysm start script: ```shell ./prysm.sh beacon-chain \ --accept-terms-of-use \ --execution-endpoint=http://localhost:8551 \ --jwt-secret=jwt.hex \ --checkpoint-sync-url https://sync-mainnet.beaconcha.in \ --genesis-beacon-api-url https://sync-mainnet.beaconcha.in \ --datadir /data/eth/prysm/chaindata ``` ## üî• Error

## üåç Your Environment **Operating System:**

**What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)** 
  
Geth version: 1.11.4-stable
CL client & version: prysm@v4.0.3
**Anything else relevant (validator index / public key)?**
same bug. "Could not compute head from new attestation"
